definitions.definition: To repay, pay back (a good deed, injury etc.).
To conduct or acquit (oneself); to behave (in a specified way).
To carry through; to go through to the end.
To set at rest; to free, as from anything harmful or oppressive; to relieve; to clear; to liberate.
To release from obligation, accusation, penalty, etc.; to absolve; to acquit.
To resign from (a job, office, position, etc.).
definitions.example: After having to work overtime without being paid, I quit my job.

definitions.definition: To stop, give up (an activity) (usually + gerund or verbal noun).
definitions.example: John is planning to quit smoking.

definitions.definition: On equal monetary terms; neither owing or being owed.
definitions.example: Here's the last of the money you lent me. We're quits now, right?

definitions.definition: Any of numerous species of small passerine birds native to tropical America.
